thread.title: Roberto Carlos Fernandes hit by tyre in Ipatinga, Brazil - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Roberto Carlos Fernandes hit by tyre in Ipatinga, Brazil - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: Roberto Carlos Fernandes hit by tyre in Ipatinga, Brazil - Yahoo7
text:
Share Roberto Carlos Fernandes hit by tyre in Ipatinga, Brazil - Yahoo7 A Brazilian man is reportedly “feeling much better” after a runaway tyre smashed him in the head and sent him face first into the pavement. Close Man struck in the head by flying tyre UP NEXT VIDEO Man struck in the head by flying tyre 
According to local media reports, Roberto Carlos Fernandes was walking with his wife in Ipatinga, Brazil, when the freak accident left him with a fractured skull and chest. 
Video from nearby security cameras does not show where the loose tyre came from, but it does reveal the horrific moment it hit Mr Fernandes. Video of the incident shows the tyre striking Roberto Carlos Fernandes in the back of the head. Photo: Viral Press 
The footage shows the tyre bouncing across the road at speed, while the 50-year-old and his wife walk away from it. 
The tyre collides directly with the man’s head, which in turn sends him spearing dangerously face-first towards the concrete. 
His wife immediately stops to try to help him as pedestrians and motorists rush to his side. Bystanders rushed to the injured man's aid after the freak accident. Photo: Viral Press 
Police have said the incident appears to be a freak accident and that it was difficult to determine where the tyre had come from. 
Mr Fernandes is reportedly recovering from his injuries in hospital and is expected to survive.
